etymology.description: 起 ‘rise’ + 义/義 ‘righteous cause’ = to rise for a righteous cause → an uprising.
etymology.interpretation: Originally emphasized a morally justified revolt; in modern usage it broadly refers to any uprising or insurrection, especially organized resistance against authority.
etymology.simplification: 義 → 义: stroke reduction by adopting a cursive/abbreviated form used in handwriting; high-frequency moral head ‘righteousness/justice’ was retained in a simpler graph. 起 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 农民在压迫下(農民在壓迫下)，发动起义(發動起義)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngmín zài yāpò xià, fādòng qǐyì.
examples.english: The peasants launched an uprising under oppression.

examples.chinese: 这次起义(這次起義)失败了(失敗了)。
他们起义(他們起義)是为了争取自由(是為了爭取自由)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen qǐyì shì wèile zhēngqǔ zìyóu.
examples.english: They rose up to fight for freedom.
